name:
£999pp -- 17-Nt Mediterranean Cruise fr Southampton in May,
                    
                         ,
description:
P&O Cruises has cut the price of a 17-night voyage to ,seven hotspots in the Med -- ,including Dubrovnik, Venice and Corfu -- to ,£999 per person,. We found the same sailing, which departs in ,mid-May,, selling for over £240 more elsewhere.,
, ,
, ,What's included,
, A 17-night cruise on P&O, Aurora,, with accommodation in an Inside Cabin and all meals and snacks.,
, ,
, ,When,
, ,Aurora, sets sail from ,Southampton, on ,17 May,.,
, ,
, ,Itinerary,
, After leaving Southampton, ,Aurora, spends two days at sea enroute to historic ,Cadiz,, in the southwest of Spain. The next stops are ,Malta,, where you'll find "prehistoric temples", "glittering hidden coves" and "a history of remarkable intensity," says ,Lonely Planet,, and ,Venice,, one of Italy's most famed cities.,
, ,
, ,Aurora, then sails to ,Koper,, Slovenia's largest coastal town and gateway to Lake Bled, followed by ,Dubrovnik,, described by ,Lonely Planet, as "one of the world's most beautiful fortified cities" and the Greek island of ,Corfu,.,
, ,
, The return journey includes a stop in ,Gibraltar,, before the ship reaches Southampton.,
, ,
, ,Ship details,
, ,Aurora, is a traditionally British ship with 12 bars, three pools -- one with a retractable skydome roof -- a theatre, a spa and a gym. Dining options include ,Cafe Bordeaux by Marco Pierre White, and the al fresco Pennant Grill (extra charges apply for both). A nice touch for guests is the brass-band send-off at Southampton.,
, ,
, ,Other options,
, Upgrade to an Outside Cabin for £200 more per person, or a Balcony Cabin for £550 more per person.

  • Bath, Gloucester, Cheltenham and Bristol are all within an hour's drive of the hotel
  • It has an AA-Rosette-awarded restaurant on site
  • Some parts of the property date from the 17th century
  • It has a VisitEngland Gold Award & a Breakfast Award

whats_included:
• It's £129 for stays until 30 April and £149 for stays from 1 May-30 June; it's an extra £10 for Friday- and Saturday-night stays (payable to the hotel direct)
  • Overnight accommodation for two people in an upgraded Superior Double Room with full English breakfast
  • A 3-course à la carte dinner for two (worth £35 per person)
  • A glass of wine each on arrival (worth £5.10 per person)
  • A 2-night stay, with the second night on a bed-and-breakfast basis, is £239 per room for stays until 30 April and £259 for stays from 1 May-30 June
name: £129 -- 'Fabulous' Cornwall Beachfront Hotel w/Meals & Wine
small_print: Not available on, 2-6 April; 23-29 May; 6, 13, 20, 27 June. Subject to availability. Rooms at the promotional price are limited, so early booking is advised.
why_we_love_it:
• You save a sizeable 60% on this stay-and-dine break on the Cornish coast
  • You get a 3-course meal in the property's AA-Rosette restaurant, which looks out over Carbis Bay Beach
  • The hotel is described as a ''fabulous'' property (Northwich Guardian) in a ''peaceful location'' (The AA Hotel Guide 2015)
  • The Tate gallery in St Ives is 10 minutes away by car and St Michael's Mount (an island with a hilltop castle that is reachable on foot at low tide) is 15 minutes away
  • When we last ran this deal, 95% of Travelzoo members who reviewed their stay said they loved it, praising the "excellent food", "fantastic location" and "friendly staff" at this "Cornish gem"
description: Situated on a hillside overlooking its own ,Blue Flag beach,, the Carbis Bay Hotel in St Ives has ,"an unrivalled position",, says ,The Daily Telegraph,. Overnight stays for two at this Cornish hideaway -- including dinner and wine -- are now £129.

why_we_love_it:
• You save up to 62% on overnight stays at Lovelady Shield a "delightful" (The AA) country house hotel on the edge of the Lake District
  • This package includes a 7-course tasting-menu dinner with matching wines for two in the 2-AA-Rosette restaurant
  • Tuck into a Cumbrian breakfast that boasts a VisitBritain Breakfast Award
  • This country manor is set in landscaped gardens on the site of a 13th-century convent on the Pennine Way, 22 miles south of Northumberland National Park
